content.user_title: Build Angular UI with CDK Utilities
content.value_statement: Creating drag-drop interfaces, overlays, and virtual scrolling lists requires deep knowledge of Angular CDK patterns. This skill provides ready-to-use code examples and best practices for implementing complex UI interactions in Angular applications.
actual_capabilities: Implement drag-and-drop interfaces with CdkDrag and CdkDropList
Create floating overlays and popups with Overlay service
Build efficient virtual scrolling lists with large datasets
Add clipboard copy functionality with ClipboardModule
Detect browser and platform capabilities using Platform service
Follow Angular CDK best practices for performance and accessibility
limitations: Does not generate complete Angular applications from scratch
Does not install or configure Angular CDK packages
Does not provide runtime debugging or testing capabilities
Focused on CDK UI utilities only, not full Angular patterns

prompt_templates.title: Basic Drag-Drop
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a drag-and-drop task board with three columns using Angular CDK drag-drop module. Include placeholder styling for dragged items.

prompt_templates.title: Overlay Menu
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a dropdown menu using Angular CDK Overlay service. Include backdrop click handling and proper cleanup on destroy.

prompt_templates.title: Virtual Scroll
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a virtual scrolling component using Angular CDK ScrollingModule that efficiently renders 10000 items with itemSize of 50 pixels.

prompt_templates.title: Platform Detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a component that detects and displays the current browser and mobile platform capabilities using Platform service.

output_examples.input: Create a drag-and-drop interface with two connected lists
output: Set up drop list with [cdkDropListConnectedTo] to link lists
Handle drop events with CdkDragDrop interface
Use moveItemInArray for reordering, transferArrayItem for moving between lists
Add drag placeholder with *cdkDragPlaceholder for visual feedback

output_examples.input: Build a virtual scrolling list for 5000 items
output: Configure viewport height and width in styles
Consider item complexity for smooth scrolling performance

best_practices: Import specific CDK modules instead of the full @angular/cdk bundle for smaller bundle size
Always clean up overlays, subscriptions, and portal attachments in ngOnDestroy
Use virtual scrolling for lists exceeding 100 items to maintain performance
anti_patterns: Using CDK directives in services or repositories instead of UI layer components
Creating overlays without implementing disposal logic
Skipping accessibility testing when implementing drag-drop and overlay interactions

faq.question: Which Angular CDK versions are supported?
faq.answer: Compatible with @angular/cdk version 20.x and Angular 20.3.x or later.

faq.question: What is the maximum list size for virtual scrolling?
faq.answer: Angular CDK virtual scrolling can handle thousands of items efficiently. Performance depends on item complexity.

faq.question: How do I connect multiple drop lists?
faq.answer: Use the [cdkDropListConnectedTo] input to specify an array of connected drop list IDs.

faq.question: Is clipboard access secure?
faq.answer: Yes, Angular CDK clipboard uses browser Clipboard API with user gesture requirements for security.

faq.question: Why is my overlay not appearing?
faq.answer: Check position strategy configuration, valid elementRef, and sufficient overlay display space.

faq.question: How does CDK compare to Material components?
faq.answer: Angular CDK provides low-level primitives without styling. Material builds on CDK with pre-styled components.
